entry.title: [US][Network] - Floating IP
entry.content:
Dec 19, 13:01 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 15/12/2022 15:09 UTC 
End time : 19/12/2022 11:45 UTC 
Service status: The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : A fix has been applied on workflow

Dec 19, 13:00 UTC
Update - Start time : 15/12/2022 15:09 UTC 
End time : 19/12/2022 11:45 UTC 
Service status: The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : A fix has been applied on workflow

Dec 16, 14:20 UTC
Update - The fix has been postponed for next Monday 19/12/2022.

Dec 15, 18:16 UTC
Update - The fix will be implemented tomorrow 16/12/2022 during the day.

Dec 15, 17:13 UTC
Identified - Start time : 15/12/2022 15:09 UTC 
Service impact : Customers that would like to add a floating IP to their network will take more time then usual to be implemented
Ongoing actions : Our teams have identified the cause of the incident and are currently preparing a fix

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers/VPS] - Rescue mode
entry.content:
Dec 19, 09:42 UTC
Completed - We are sorry to inform you that this maintenance is postponed to another date. We will keep you updated as soon as the date is fixed.

Dec 19, 09:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 15, 18:03 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 19/12/2022 09:00 UTC 
End time : 19/12/2022 10:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to remove options 'rescue64-pro' and 'rescue64-ovh' and replace them by 'rescue-customer' in 'Boot rescue mode' for dedicated and virtual private servers.
To use rescue mode, you can refer to the current link: https://docs.ovh.com/fr/dedicated/ovh-rescue/#en-pratique

entry.title: VPS - WAW2 - host1268402
entry.content:
Dec 18, 20:45 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 18, 19:57 UTC
Investigating - Estimated time to recovery : 1 hour(s)

Affected hosts

host1268402

Affected instances

The list of instances listed below are currently
unavailable, due to hardware fault on the hypervisor(s) previously mentioned. We apologize for
any inconvenience caused while we resolve this issue.

entry.title: [GRA2][Dedicated Servers] - G261A05
entry.content:
Dec 18, 18:51 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 18/12/2022 18:04 UTC 
End Time : 18/12/2022 18:30 UTC 
Our technical teams replaced the faulty equipment. . All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 18, 18:18 UTC
Identified - Start time : 18/12/2022 18:04 UTC 
Service impact : vRack network unavailable.
Root cause : vRack the switch has restarted several times (Reason: Kernel Panic) :
Sun Oct 23 at 05:33 UTC
Sun Dec 18 at 14:22 UTC
Sun Dec 18 at 15:06 UTC
Sun Dec 18 at 15:51 UTC
Sun Dec 18 at 16:35 UTC
Sun Dec 18 at 17:20 UTC
Ongoing actions : Our teams will replace the faulty network equipment.

entry.title: [RBX2][DedicatedServers] - Rack 23A18
entry.content:
Dec 18, 12:01 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 18/12/2022 10:11 UTC
End Time : 18/12/2022 12:00 UTC
Root cause : Electrical malfunction
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 18, 10:35 UTC
Identified - Start time : 18/12/2022 10:11 UTC
Service impact : Servers in the rack 23A18 are no longer responding.
Root cause : Electrical malfunction
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.

Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be post as significant progress is made.
